items.stem: Who is responsible for health and safety in the workplace?
items.rationale: Under the Health and Safety at Work Act 1974, everyone has a duty of care.

items.stem: What is the main purpose of the Health and Safety at Work Act?
options: To protect people from work-related harm
items.rationale: The Act exists to ensure the health, safety, and welfare of people at work.

items.stem: Which of the following are duties of an employee? (Select two)
options: Take reasonable care of their own safety
Cooperate with the employer on safety matters
items.rationale: Employees must look after themselves and cooperate; employers provide training and equipment.
